definition: move the mouth as in speaking
faltering steps, mumbling speech (idiom); hesitant/cringing/to cower

sentences.english: His lips framed a few words.
Whose voices are speaking the same words with hesitation?
sentences.chinese: 嗫嚅着同一话语的不同嗓音是谁的？

sentences.english: The narrator, whose voice had faltered lately, stopped.
sentences.chinese: 叙述者的声音越来越嗫嚅了，说到这里便停止住。

sentences.english: "Why do I have to go" whined Carla.
Hesitantly, I inquired about the destination of the food.
sentences.chinese: 我嗫嚅着问他这些食物会运到何处。

sentences.english: Yes, yes I'll write it, " I mumbled and dropped the phone."
sentences.chinese: “对，对，我会写的，”我嗫嚅着挂上了电话。

sentences.english: How emotion could you once know me to speak haltingly to worry lightly?
sentences.chinese: 你可曾知我嗫嚅着怎样的情感轻愁？

definition: to respond evasively or vaguely/to elude/to stall
to hum and haw (idiom); to mumble as if hiding sth/to speak and break off, then start again/to hold sth back
to hem and haw/to stall/to stammer/to mumble/to falter
to show signs of reluctance or embarrassment
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
agape and tongue-tied (idiom); at a loss for words/gaping and speechless
trill (of voice)/see also 顫聲|颤声[zhan4 sheng1]
trembling voice/see also 顫聲|颤声[chan4 sheng1]
